sen.j: 伝習隊（でんしゅうたい）とは、江戸幕府が幕府陸軍の精鋭部隊として編成した、フランス軍事顧問団の直接指導を受ける西洋式軍隊のこと。
sen.e: Denshutai (Edo shogunate's army) refers to the western-style army which was organized by Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as the elite troops of the bakufu army, and wasdirectly trained by the French Military Advisory Group.
sen.cmt: フランス軍事顧問団→ the French Military Advisory Group＜定訳不明＞

sen.cmt: 先行詞とwhichの間に「、」を加えました。改行を削除しました。
sen.e: Denshutai (Edo shogunate's army) refers to the western-style army which was organized by Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) as the elite troops of the bakufu army, and was directly trained by the French Military Advisory Group.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では約1100名が旧幕府軍の主力として戦った。
sen.e: At the Boshin War, 1100 soldiers of this army fought as the main force of the Old Shogunate army.

At the Boshin War, 1100 soldiers of this army fought as the main force of the Old Shogunate army.

sen.j: 残りは長州藩傘下の帰正隊として新政府軍に参加して旧幕府軍と戦った。
sen.e: The rest of the soldiers joined the new government army as Kiseitai (militia) and fought with the Old Shogunate army.
The rest of the soldiers joined the new government army as Kiseitai (militia) and fought with the Old Shogunate army.
The rest of the soldiers joined the new government army as Kiseitai (militia) and fought with the Old Shogunate army.

sen.j: 兵士には、博徒・やくざ・雲助・馬丁・町火消などの江戸の無頼の徒を徴募して編成し、シャルル・シャノワーヌやジュール・ブリュネなどのフランス軍顧問により直接フランス式の調練を施された部隊である。
sen.e: The soldiers were composed of a gang of outlaws in Edo including Bakuto (gamblers), Yakuza (Japanese mafia), Kumosuke (shifty carrier), Batei (horse keeper) and Machibikeshi (civilian firefighters), and the troops were gotten the French style military training directly from French military advisers, such as Charles Chanoine and Jules Brunet.

The soldiers were composed of a gang of outlaws in Edo including Bakuto (gamblers), Yakuza (Japanese mafia), Kumosuke (shifty carrier), Batei (horse keeper) and Machibikeshi (civilian firefighters), and the troops received the French style military training directly from French military advisers, such as Charles Chanoine and Jules Brunet.

sen.j: 指揮官には大鳥圭介などがいた。
sen.e: Keisuke OTORI was the commander.
Keisuke OTORI was a commander.
sen.cmt: 「など」としているので、the commanderというよりは、a commanderの方が正しいと思います。
sen.e: Keisuke OTORI was a commander.

sen.j: 当時最新鋭の装備を誇っていた。
sen.e: They had the most advanced equipments at that time.
They had the most advanced equipments at that time.
They had the most advanced equipments at that time.

sen.j: 号令はすべてフランス語で行われていた。
sen.e: The words of command was all in French.
The words of command was all in French.
The words of command was all in French.

sen.j: 1867年（慶応3年）に創設。
sen.e: Denshutai was established in 1867.
Denshutai was established in 1867.
Denshutai was established in 1867.

sen.j: 鳥羽・伏見の戦いでは伝習隊の一部が幕府陸軍の一部隊として参戦。
sen.e: A part of Denshutai joined the Battle of Toba-Fushimi as a military unit of the bakufu army.
A part of Denshutai joined the Battle of Toba-Fushimi as a military unit of the bakufu army.
A part of Denshutai joined the Battle of Toba-Fushimi as a military unit of the bakufu army.

sen.j: 敗北するもそれなりに善戦した。
sen.e: They were defeated but fought well.
They were defeated but fought well.
They were defeated but fought well.

sen.j: 江戸開城時に、江戸の旧幕府軍の多くは新政府に帰順したが、伝習隊の多くは帰順しなかった。
sen.e: At the surrender of Edo Castle, most of the Old Shogunate army in Edo surrendered but most of Denshutai did not surrender.
sen.cmt: 旧幕府軍→ the Old Shogunate army＜定訳不明＞

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）2月から4月にかけて、2000人から3000人の幕府歩兵隊や新撰組などが江戸を脱走した際に、大鳥圭介に同行して伝習第一大隊、第二大隊の1100名ほどが脱走した。
sen.e: When two to three thousands soldiers of the feudal government's infantry and Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) escaped from Edo from February to April in 1868, about 1100 soldiers of the first and second battalions of Denshutai escaped with Keisuke OTORI.

When 2000 to 3000 soldiers of the feudal government's infantry and Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) escaped from Edo between February and April 1868, about 1100 soldiers of the first and second battalions of Denshutai escaped with Keisuke OTORI.
sen.cmt: 兵士の数がスペルアウト、アラビア数字両方あるので、アラビア数字に統一します。from February to April in 1868を、between February and April 1868 と変更しました。
sen.e: When 2000 to 3000 soldiers of the feudal government's infantry and Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) escaped from Edo between February and April 1868, about 1100 soldiers of the first and second battalions of Denshutai escaped with Keisuke OTORI.

sen.j: 脱走した伝習隊などの約2000人は、4月12日に下総市川の国府台に集結して、大鳥圭介を総督（隊長）、土方歳三を参謀として部隊を編成した。
sen.e: Escaped 2000 soldiers including Denshutai got together at Konodai in Shimousaichikawa on April 12, and formed troops with Keisuke OTORI and Toshizo HIJIKATA as their general staff.

Escaped 2000 soldiers including Denshutai got together at Konodai in Shimousaichikawa on April 12, and formed troops with Keisuke OTORI as governor-general (commander) and Toshizo HIJIKATA as their staff officer.
sen.cmt: 「総督（隊長）」が訳漏れです。governor-general (commander) としました。
sen.e: Escaped 2000 soldiers including Denshutai got together at Konodai in Shimousaichikawa on April 12, and formed troops with Keisuke OTORI as governor-general (commander) and Toshizo HIJIKATA as their staff officer.

sen.j: その後、北関東に向かい、途中の小山で西軍を撃破した。
sen.e: After that, they smashed the West squad in Oyama on the way to the North Kanto.
After that, they defeated the West squad in Oyama on the way to the North Kanto.
sen.cmt: smashed だとどちらかというと「破壊する」という意味が強く思えるので、敵を破るという意味で、defeatedとしました。
sen.e: After that, they defeated the West squad in Oyama on the way to the North Kanto.

sen.j: さらに宇都宮城へと進軍、宇都宮を奪還した。
sen.e: Moreover, they advanced to the Utsunomiya Castle and regained Utsunomiya.
Moreover, they advanced to the Utsunomiya Castle and regained Utsunomiya.
Moreover, they advanced to the Utsunomiya Castle and regained Utsunomiya.

sen.j: 別行動を取った草風隊、回天隊などの旗本子弟の部隊約700人も合流(後の伝習士官隊）、北関東から北陸・会津で戦い、最後は北海道の五稜郭へと転戦する。
sen.e: The troops of approximately 700 soldiers of the children of hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu), such as Sofutai and Kaitentai (military units), which went separate ways, joined with them (which became Denshushikantai later), and then fought from North Kanto to Hokuriku and Aizu, finally, ended up fighting in Gokokaku in Hokkaido.

Approximately 700 soldiers of Sofutai (a military unit) and Kaitentai (a military unit), which were troops of hatamoto shitei (children and/or younger hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu)) and were on separate activity, joined with them (which became Denshushikantai later) to fight together at North Kanto to Hokuriku/Aizu, and finally they fought in Goryokaku in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 「五稜郭」がミススペルです。書き換えました。
sen.e: Approximately 700 soldiers of Sofutai (a military unit) and Kaitentai (a military unit), which were troops of hatamoto shitei (children of hatamoto [direct retainers of the bakufu]) and were on separate activity, joined with them (which became Denshushikantai later) to fight together at North Kanto to Hokuriku/Aizu, and finally they fought in Goryokaku in Hokkaido.

sen.j: （歩兵隊指揮は大川正次郎）

sen.j: 1869年（明治2）5月18日、榎本武揚を筆頭とする五稜郭の旧幕府軍の降伏に従い、伝習隊も降伏して解散した。
sen.e: When the Old Shogunate army led by Takeaki ENOMOTO surrendered at Goryokaku in May 18, 1869, Denshutai also surrendered and demobilized.
When the Old Shogunate army led by Takeaki ENOMOTO surrendered at Goryokaku in May 18, 1869, Denshutai also surrendered and demobilized.

sen.j: こうして戊辰戦争も終わった。
sen.e: Consequently, the Boshin War ended.
And thus the Boshin War ended.

sen.j: 一方、帰正隊として新政府に編入された残余の伝習隊は房総半島の鎮撫活動に活躍し、明治2年には箱館に向けて出陣し、脱走幕府軍を攻撃した。
sen.e: At the same time, the rest of Denshutai who joined the new government as Kiseitai contributed to the suppression in the Boso Peninsula, and in 1869, they went toward Hakodate to attack the bakufu army that had escaped.

On the other hand, the rest of Denshutai who joined the new government as Kiseitai contributed to the suppression of the Boso Peninsula, and they took the field to Hakodate in 1869 to attack the escaped bakufu army.
sen.cmt: 「一方」を「At the same time」としていますが、「On the other hand」と修正します。「suppression in」を「suppression of」と変更しました。「the bakufu army that had escaped.」を「the escaped bakufu army」と変更しました。「出陣する」をwent towardとしていますが、took the field to と変更しました。In 1869を続けました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the rest of Denshutai who joined the new government as Kiseitai contributed to the suppression of the Boso Peninsula, and they took the field to Hakodate in 1869 to attack the escaped bakufu army.

sen.j: その後の日本陸軍の礎となって解散した。
sen.e: They became the foundation of the Japanese Army.
They became the foundation of the later Japanese Army, and demobilized.
